name: add_line_item_to_event_worksheet
description: Create a line item with given cell values.

target_event_for_line_item.description: The unique identifier of the event to which the line item will belong.

target_worksheet_for_line_item.description: The unique identifier of the worksheet to which the line item will belong.

new_line_item_data.description: A dictionary containing the properties for the new line item, including:

data.description: A hashmap where keys are data identifier strings for the columns in the worksheet, and values are cell values, where each value contains:

name: add_multiple_line_items_to_worksheet
description: Creates multiple line items in the specified event worksheet.

target_event_for_bulk_add.description: The unique identifier of the event to which the line items will belong.

target_worksheet_for_bulk_add.description: The unique identifier of the worksheet to which the line items will belong.

data.description: A hashmap where keys are data identifier strings for the columns in the worksheet, and values are cell values, where each value contains:

list_of_new_line_items.description:
A list of dictionaries, where each dictionary contains
the properties for a new line item, including:

name: add_options_to_field
description: Creates a new field option with given parameters..

target_field_id_for_options.description: The field ID to associate the options with. If not provided, the field ID will be generated.

list_of_field_options.description: A list of options to be associated with the field.

name: assign_companies_to_project
description: Adds one or more supplier companies to a project.

project_id_for_company_assignment.description: The unique identifier of the project.

company_ids_to_assign.description:
A list of supplier company IDs to add to the project.
For optimal performance, it's recommended to add 10 or fewer
suppliers in a single request.

name: assign_contacts_to_event_by_external_ids
description: Add suppliers to an event using supplier contacts. Only events of type RFP are supported. You must supply the unique event external identifier (the one you used when created the event). You must supply the external identifiers of the supplier contacts too. The operation will be rolled back upon any failure, and invitations won't be sent. For best performance, we recommend inviting 10 or less supplier contacts in a single request.

target_event_external_id.description: The unique external identifier of the event to which suppliers will be added.

contact_external_ids_payload.description: A dictionary containing the supplier contact information, including:

supplier_contact_external_ids.description: A list of supplier contact external IDs to be added to the event

name: assign_contacts_to_event_by_id
description: Adds supplier contacts to a specific event. Only events of type RFP are supported.

rfp_event_identifier.description:
The unique identifier of the event to which supplier
contacts will be added.

contact_ids_payload.description:
A dictionary containing the supplier contact information,
including:

supplier_contact_ids.description:
A list of supplier contact IDs to be
    added to the event

name: assign_contacts_to_project_by_external_refs
description:
Adds suppliers to a project using supplier contact external identifiers.

This endpoint links supplier contacts to an existing project by referencing their external identifiers. This is particularly useful for bulk-inviting suppliers already registered in the system.

project_external_ref_for_contact_assignm.description: External ID of the project to which suppliers should be added.

list_of_contact_external_ids.description: External IDs of the supplier contacts to add to the project.

name: assign_contacts_to_project_by_internal_id
description: Adds one or more supplier contacts to a project.

target_project_id.description: The unique identifier of the project.

contact_ids_to_add.description: A list of supplier contact IDs to add to the project.

name: assign_suppliers_to_event_by_external_id
description: Add suppliers to an event using external identifiers. Only events of type RFP are supported.

target_rfp_event_external_id.description:
The unique external identifier of the event to
which suppliers will be added.

supplier_external_ids_payload.description: A dictionary containing the supplier information, including:

supplier_external_ids.description:
A list of supplier external IDs to be
    added to the event

name: assign_suppliers_to_event_by_id
description: Add suppliers to an event. Only events of type RFP are supported.

target_event_id.description:
The unique identifier of the event to which suppliers
will be added.

supplier_id_data_payload.description: A dictionary containing the supplier information, including:

supplier_ids.description: A list of supplier IDs to be added to the event

name: define_new_custom_field
description:
Create a field with given parameters.

For fields with target_object set to RFP, group relationship should be omitted. It is required to specify the relationship for all other target objects.

custom_field_unique_id.description: The unique identifier for the new field. If not provided, the system will generate a new ID.

custom_field_configuration.description: A dictionary containing the field configuration options. Can contain any of the following fields:

type_description.description:
Internal name and meaning of each field, one of:
        - "Checkbox"
        - "File"
        - "Short Text"
        - "Paragraph"
        - "Date"
        - "Integer"
        - "Currency"
        - "Decimal"
        - "Single Select"
        - "Multiple Select"
        - "URL"
        - "Lookup"
        - "Related"

required.description: Identifies whether the field is required

group.description:
Reference to the field group where the field belongs to
        Note: Must be null for fields with target_object set to RFP, and required for all other fields

name: delete_contact_category_by_id
description: Deletes a contact type from the system.

contact_type_id_to_remove.description: The unique internal identifier of the contact type to delete.

name: describe_contract_object_fields
description: Retrieve a list of all available fields for the contract object.

name: describe_project_object_fields
description: Retrieves a list of all available fields for project objects.

name: disable_scim_user_account
description:
Deactivates a user by their unique identifier.

This operation marks the user as inactive. The core logic to prevent self-deactivation
(which would result in a 403 error) or to handle a non-existent user (404 error)
is assumed to be part of the broader system or interactions with the 'db' object.

scim_user_id_to_deactivate.description: Unique SCIM user identifier of the user to deactivate.

name: establish_supplier_segmentation
description:
Creates a new supplier company segmentation.

This function registers a new segmentation category used to organize supplier
companies within the platform. The segmentation is defined by a label, display order,
and optional slug for programmatic reference.

label.description: Required. Display label for the segmentation (≤ 255 characters).

name: fetch_attachment_by_external_id
description: Retrieve a specific attachment by its external ID.

attachment_external_identifier.description: The external ID of the attachment to retrieve.

name: fetch_attachment_by_internal_id
description: Retrieve a specific attachment by its internal ID.

attachment_internal_id.description: The internal ID of the attachment to retrieve.

name: fetch_award_line_item_by_id
description: Retrieve details of a specific award line item.

line_item_id_for_award.description: The unique identifier of the award line item to retrieve.

award_line_item_resources_to_include.description:
Use the _include parameter to request related resources along with the primary resource.
Supported includes: "supplier_company", "worksheet".

name: fetch_bid_details_by_id
description: Retrieves the details of an existing bid. You need to supply the unique bid identifier that was returned upon bid creation.

bid_unique_identifier.description:
The unique internal identifier of the bid to retrieve. This ID is
typically returned when the bid is created in the system. Must be a
positive integer.

include_bid_related_data.description:
A comma-separated string specifying additional
related data to include in the response. Common options include:
- 'event': Include associated event details
- 'supplier_company': Include supplier information
Defaults to None.

name: fetch_bid_line_item_details
description:
Retrieves the details of an existing bid line item.

This function locates a specific bid line item using its unique identifier
and returns its complete details if found.

bid_line_item_identifier.description: The unique identifier of the bid line item to retrieve.

name: fetch_company_contact_by_ids
description:
Retrieves the details of an existing supplier company contact.

This function locates a specific contact using both the company ID and contact ID,
then returns the complete contact details with optional related resource inclusion.

supplier_company_identifier.description:
The unique identifier of the supplier company.
This is the internal ID used by the system to reference the company.

company_contact_identifier.description:
The unique identifier of the contact.
This is the internal ID used by the system to reference the contact.

optional_response_inclusions.description:
Comma-separated list of related resources to include
in the response. Not fully implemented in simulation.

name: fetch_contract_award_details
description:
Retrieves detailed information about a specific contract award.

This function returns comprehensive information about a contract award,
including all its associated data and configurations. The function provides
complete visibility into award details and associated metrics.

award_identifier.description: The unique internal identifier of the award to retrieve.

name: fetch_contract_award_line_item_details
description:
Retrieves detailed information about a specific award line item.

This function returns comprehensive information about a contract award line
item, including all its associated data and configurations. The function
provides complete visibility into line item details and associated metrics.

award_line_item_id.description: The unique identifier of the award line item to retrieve.

name: fetch_contract_by_external_id
description: Retrieve details of a specific contract by its external ID.

contract_external_identifier.description: The external identifier of the contract to retrieve.

contract_related_resources_to_fetch.description:
Comma-separated list of relationships to include
in the response.
Supported values: "contract_type", "spend_category", "supplier_company", "docusign_envelopes", "adobe_sign_agreements"

name: fetch_contract_by_internal_id
description: Retrieve details of a specific contract by its internal ID.

contract_internal_id.description: The internal identifier of the contract to retrieve.

contract_related_resources_to_include.description:
Comma-separated list of relationships to include
in the response. 
Supported values: "contract_type", "spend_category", "supplier_company", "docusign_envelopes", "adobe_sign_agreements"

name: fetch_contract_milestone_schema
description:
Retrieves the contract milestone report schema.

The schema defines the structure and expected data types for each field in a contract milestone report entry. 
This information is useful for dynamically generating forms, validating input, or formatting report data.

name: fetch_contract_report_schema
description:
Retrieves the schema definition for contract report entries.

The schema outlines the available fields, their types, and how data is structured within contract reports. 
This information is useful for dynamically interpreting or building UIs and integrations based on contract data fields.

name: fetch_contract_type_by_external_id
description: Retrieve details of a specific contract type by its external ID.

contract_type_external_identifier.description: The external identifier of the contract type to retrieve.

name: fetch_contract_type_by_internal_id
description: Retrieve details of a specific contract type by its internal ID.

contract_type_internal_id.description: The internal identifier of the contract type to retrieve.

name: fetch_event_details_by_id
description: Retrieve details of a specific event.

event_unique_identifier.description: The unique identifier of the event to retrieve.

name: fetch_event_report_schema
description:
Retrieves the schema definition for event report entries.

This schema provides metadata about the fields available in event report entries, including their names and data types. It can be used to dynamically interpret and render event report data.

name: fetch_event_template_details
description: Retrieves the details of an existing event template by its ID.

event_template_id.description: The unique internal identifier of the event template to retrieve.

name: fetch_event_worksheet_details
description: Retrieves the details of an existing worksheet. You need to supply the unique worksheet identifier that was returned upon worksheet creation.

parent_event_identifier.description: The unique identifier of the event to which the worksheet belongs.

worksheet_identifier.description: The unique identifier of the worksheet to retrieve.

name: fetch_field_by_external_id
description:
Retrieves the details of a specific field by its external ID.

This function returns the complete details of a field identified by its
external identifier. The function searches through all fields to find a
match for the provided external ID.

field_external_identifier.description: The external identifier of the field to retrieve.

name: fetch_field_group_details
description:
Retrieves the details of a specific field group by its ID.

This function returns the complete details of a field group identified by its
unique identifier. The function supports both string and integer ID formats.

field_group_identifier.description: The unique identifier of the field group to retrieve.

name: fetch_performance_review_answer_schema
description:
Retrieves the schema for performance review answer reports.

This schema outlines the structure of performance review answers returned by the API, including field names and their respective data types. Useful for dynamic rendering or processing of answer entries.

name: fetch_performance_review_schema
description:
Retrieves the schema for the performance review report.

The schema defines the structure of performance review report entries, including field types and names. This is useful for dynamically building forms, validating input, or rendering reports.

name: fetch_project_by_external_id
description: Retrieves the details of a specific project using its external identifier.

project_external_identifier.description: The unique external identifier of the project to retrieve.

name: fetch_project_by_internal_id
description: Retrieves the details of a specific project using its unique internal identifier.

project_internal_identifier.description: The unique internal identifier of the project to retrieve.

name: fetch_project_category_by_id
description: Retrieves detailed information about a specific project type using its unique identifier.

project_type_unique_id.description: Unique identifier of the project type.

name: fetch_project_milestone_schema
description:
Retrieves the schema definition for project milestone reports.

This endpoint provides metadata describing the fields available in project milestone reporting. Useful for dynamically rendering forms or parsing report data.

name: fetch_project_report_schema
description:
Retrieves the schema definition for project report entries.

The schema provides metadata about the fields used in project reports, including field names and data types.

name: fetch_savings_report_schema
description:
Retrieves the schema definition for the savings report.

The schema provides a list of fields and their types used in the savings report entries. This is useful for understanding the expected structure and available data fields when creating or interpreting report entries.

name: fetch_scim_provider_configuration
description:
Retrieves the SCIM service provider configuration, describing supported features and capabilities.

This endpoint returns metadata about the SCIM implementation, including patch, filter, bulk, authentication schemes, and more, as specified in Section 5 of RFC 7643.

name: fetch_scim_resource_metadata
description:
Retrieves metadata for a specific SCIM resource type.

This endpoint provides the schema, endpoint path, and any extensions supported for a given SCIM resource (e.g., "User"). It returns a subset of the information available from the general `/ResourceTypes` endpoint, focusing on a single resource type.

scim_resource_type_name.description:
Name of the SCIM resource type.
- Example: "User"

name: fetch_scim_resource_type_by_name
description:
Retrieves metadata for a specific SCIM resource type.

This endpoint provides the schema, endpoint path, and any extensions supported for a given SCIM resource (e.g., "User"). It returns a subset of the information available from the general `/ResourceTypes` endpoint, focusing on a single resource type.

scim_resource_name.description:
Name of the SCIM resource type.
- Example: "User"

name: fetch_scim_schema_by_uri
description:
Retrieves a specific SCIM schema by its URI.

This endpoint provides the structure and metadata for a SCIM resource type, including all attributes and constraints, as defined by the schema URI (e.g., User, Group).

scim_schema_uri.description:
Schema URI identifying the SCIM resource type.
- Example: "urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:core:2.0:User"

name: fetch_scim_user_details
description:
Retrieves the details of a single user by SCIM resource ID.

This endpoint conforms to SCIM 2.0 RFC 7644 Section 3.4.1, returning user metadata,
core attributes, and optional related roles or identifiers.

scim_user_identifier.description: Unique SCIM identifier of the user to retrieve.

requested_user_attributes.description:
Optional comma-separated list of attributes to return in the response.
Allowed:
- "userName"
- "name.familyName"
- "name.givenName"
- "roles"
- "roles.value"
- "externalId"
- "active"
- "meta.lastModified"
- "meta.created"

user_search_filter_expression.description:
Optional filter to apply to the user search.
Currently not implemented.

name: fetch_spend_category_by_external_id
description:
Retrieves the details of a specific spend category by its unique identifier.

Spend categories define classification for various types of organizational spend such as procurement, expenses, supplier invoices, etc.

spend_category_external_id.description: Unique identifier of the spend category.

name: fetch_spend_category_by_internal_id
description:
Retrieves the details of an existing spend category using its internal identifier.

Internal IDs allow referencing spend categories directly in the database. This is useful for internal operations and direct database access.

spend_category_internal_id.description: Internal identifier of the spend category.

name: fetch_supplier_company_by_external_ref
description:
Retrieves a supplier company using its external identifier.

This endpoint fetches the details of a supplier company by its unique external ID. Related resources can be included using the `include` query parameter.

company_external_identifier.description: Required. The external identifier of the supplier company. Example: "1234-5678-abcd-efgh"

supplier_company_related_resources.description:
Comma-separated list of related resources to include in the response. 
Enum values:
- "attachments"
- "supplier_category"
- "supplier_groups"
- "default_payment_term"
- "payment_types"
- "default_payment_type"
- "payment_currencies"
- "default_payment_currency"
- "supplier_classification_values"

name: fetch_supplier_company_by_id
description:
Retrieves the details of an existing supplier company.

This function fetches all metadata and linked relationships for a supplier
company using its unique identifier. Related resources can optionally be
included using the `include` query parameter.

supplier_company_id.description:
Required. Unique identifier of the supplier company.
Example: 1

related_supplier_resources_to_include.description:
Comma-separated list of related resources to include.
Allowed values:
- "attachments"
- "supplier_category"
- "supplier_groups"
- "default_payment_term"
- "payment_types"
- "default_payment_type"
- "payment_currencies"
- "default_payment_currency"
- "supplier_classification_values"

name: fetch_supplier_contact_by_external_ref
description:
Retrieves the details of an existing supplier contact by external ID.

This function returns the full resource representation of a supplier contact
identified by its external ID, with optional inclusion of related entities.

contact_external_identifier.description:
Required. Unique external identifier of the supplier contact.
Example: "CNT-17"

related_entities_to_include.description:
Comma-separated list of related resources to include in the response.
Allowed values:
- "supplier_company"
- "contact_types"
- "phones"

name: fetch_supplier_contact_by_internal_id
description:
Retrieves the details of an existing supplier contact by ID.

This function returns full information about a supplier contact, including their
attributes and optionally included related resources such as contact types, phones,
and linked supplier company.

supplier_contact_id.description: Required. Unique identifier of the supplier contact.

include_related_resources.description:
Comma-separated list of related resources to include in the response.
Allowed values:
- "supplier_company"
- "contact_types"
- "phones"

name: fetch_supplier_details_by_id
description:
Retrieves the details of an existing supplier company by its unique ID.

This function searches for a supplier in the database by their ID and returns
the supplier object if found, or None if not found.

supplier_database_id.description: Unique identifier of the supplier company to retrieve.

name: fetch_supplier_report_schema
description:
Returns the supplier report schema.

This function retrieves the schema definition for supplier reports, including
field names, types, and metadata that describe how supplier report entries are structured.

name: fetch_supplier_review_schema
description:
Returns the supplier review report schema.

This function retrieves the schema definition for supplier review reports. The schema
describes the structure of review report entries, including the type and name of each field.

name: fetch_worksheet_line_item_details
description:
Retrieves the details of an existing line item. You need to supply the unique line item identifier that 

was returned upon line item creation.

item_parent_event_id.description: The unique identifier of the event to which the line item belongs.

item_parent_worksheet_id.description: The unique identifier of the worksheet to which the line item belongs.

line_item_unique_id.description: The unique identifier of the line item to retrieve.

name: find_all_attachments_by_id_filter
description:
Returns a filtered list of attachments based on the `filter[id_equals]` param.

The result is limited to 50 attachments.

attachment_ids_for_filtering.description:
Comma-separated string of attachment IDs to filter by. Defaults to None.
If None, all attachments are returned (up to the limit).

name: find_awards_by_criteria
description:
Retrieve a list of awards based on specified filter criteria.

This function supports filtering awards by their state and update timestamps.
Multiple filters can be combined to narrow down the results.

award_state_filter.description:
List of states to filter awards by.
Valid states include: "draft" "confirmed" "awaiting_requisition_sync" "requisition_created".

award_updated_since_filter.description: Return awards updated on or after the specified timestamp..

award_updated_before_filter.description: Return awards updated on or before the specified timestamp.

name: find_company_contacts_by_external_id
description:
Retrieves contacts associated with a supplier company by external identifier.

This function returns all contacts for a specific supplier company and optionally
filters them based on provided criteria. The external ID must match the one used
when the company was created.

company_external_identifier_for_lookup.description:
Required. External identifier of the supplier company.
Example: "COMP-001"

related_contact_data_to_include.description:
Comma-separated list of related resources to include.
Currently not fully implemented.

contact_search_criteria.description:
Optional filter criteria to apply to contacts.
Each key-value pair in the dictionary will be used to filter contacts.

name: find_contracts_with_filters
description:
Retrieve a list of contracts based on specified criteria.

This function supports filtering, relationship inclusion, and pagination of contracts.
Contracts can be filtered based on any attribute present in the contract object.

contract_query_criteria.description: Dictionary containing filter criteria for contracts. Supported filters:

updated_at_from.description: Return contracts updated on or after timestamp

updated_at_to.description: Return contracts updated on or before timestamp

title_contains.description: Return contracts with title containing string

title_not_contains.description: Return contracts with title not containing string

description_contains.description: Return contracts with description containing string

description_not_contains.description: Return contracts with description not containing string

external_id_equals.description: Find contracts by specific external ID

external_id_not_equals.description: Find contracts excluding specified external ID

actual_start_date_from.description: Return contracts started on or after date

actual_start_date_to.description: Return contracts started on or before date

actual_end_date_from.description: Return contracts ended on or after date

actual_end_date_to.description: Return contracts ended on or before date

needs_attention_equals.description: Return contracts with specified needs attention status

needs_attention_not_equals.description: Return contracts with needs attention status not equal

terminated_note_contains.description: Return contracts with termination note containing string

terminated_note_not_contains.description: Return contracts with termination note not containing string

terminated_note_empty.description: Return contracts with empty termination note

terminated_note_not_empty.description: Return contracts with non-empty termination note

terminated_reason_contains.description: Return contracts with termination reason containing string

terminated_reason_not_contains.description: Return contracts with termination reason not containing string

terminated_reason_empty.description: Return contracts with empty termination reason

terminated_reason_not_empty.description: Return contracts with non-empty termination reason

contract_type_id_equals.description: Find contracts with specified contract type

contract_type_id_not_equals.description: Find contracts with different contract type

marked_as_needs_attention_at_from.description: Find contracts marked needs attention after date

marked_as_needs_attention_at_to.description: Find contracts marked needs attention before date

needs_attention_note_contains.description: Return contracts with needs attention note containing string

needs_attention_note_not_contains.description: Return contracts with needs attention note not containing string

needs_attention_note_empty.description: Return contracts with empty needs attention note

needs_attention_note_not_empty.description: Return contracts with non-empty needs attention note

needs_attention_reason_contains.description: Return contracts with needs attention reason containing string

needs_attention_reason_not_contains.description: Return contracts with needs attention reason not containing string

needs_attention_reason_empty.description: Return contracts with empty needs attention reason

needs_attention_reason_not_empty.description: Return contracts with non-empty needs attention reason

renewal_termination_notice_date_from.description: Find contracts with termination notice date >= specified

renewal_termination_notice_date_to.description: Find contracts with termination notice date <= specified

renewal_termination_reminder_date_from.description: Find contracts with termination reminder date >= specified

renewal_termination_reminder_date_to.description: Find contracts with termination reminder date <= specified

spend_category_id_equals.description: Find contracts using specified Spend Category IDs

include_contract_relationships.description:
Comma-separated list of relationships to include in response.
Supported values: "contract_type", "spend_category", "supplier_company", 
"docusign_envelopes", "adobe_sign_agreements"

size.description: Number of results per page (default: 10, max: 100)

name: find_events_by_criteria
description: Returns a list of events for the specified criteria.

event_search_filters.description:
Dictionary containing filter criteria where keys are
event attributes and values are the desired values to match. Supported filters:

updated_at_from.description: Return events updated on or after timestamp

updated_at_to.description: Return events updated on or before timestamp

title_contains.description: Return events with title containing string

title_not_contains.description: Return events with title not containing string

spend_category_id_equals.description: Find events using specified Spend Category IDs

request_type_equals.description: Find events with specified request types

supplier_rsvp_deadline_from.description: Return events with RSVP deadline on or after date

supplier_rsvp_deadline_to.description: Return events with RSVP deadline on or before date

supplier_rsvp_deadline_empty.description: Return events with RSVP deadline not set

supplier_rsvp_deadline_not_empty.description: Return events with RSVP deadline set

supplier_question_deadline_from.description: Return events with questions deadline on or after date

supplier_question_deadline_to.description: Return events with questions deadline on or before date

supplier_question_deadline_empty.description: Return events with questions deadline not set

supplier_question_deadline_not_empty.description: Return events with questions deadline set

bid_submission_deadline_from.description: Return events with bid deadline on or after date

bid_submission_deadline_to.description: Return events with bid deadline on or before date

bid_submission_deadline_empty.description: Return events with bid deadline not set

bid_submission_deadline_not_empty.description: Return events with bid deadline set

created_at_from.description: Return events created on or after timestamp

created_at_to.description: Return events created on or before timestamp

published_at_from.description: Return events published on or after timestamp

published_at_to.description: Return events published on or before timestamp

closed_at_from.description: Return events closed on or after timestamp

closed_at_to.description: Return events closed on or before timestamp

spend_amount_from.description: Return events with spend amount >= amount

spend_amount_to.description: Return events with spend amount <= amount

spend_amount_empty.description: Return events with spend amount not set

spend_amount_not_empty.description: Return events with spend amount set

external_id_equals.description: Find events by specific external ID

external_id_not_equals.description: Find events excluding specified external ID

size.description: Number of results per page (default: 10, max: 100)

name: find_projects_with_filters
description: Retrieves a list of projects based on optional filtering criteria and pagination settings.

project_search_criteria.description: A dictionary containing filter criteria for projects. Supported filters include:

updated_at_from.description: Return projects updated on or after the specified timestamp

updated_at_to.description: Return projects updated on or before the specified timestamp

number_from.description: Find projects with number equal or greater than the specified one

number_to.description: Find projects with number equal or smaller than the specified one

title_contains.description: Return projects with title containing the specified string

title_not_contains.description: Return projects with title not containing the specified string

description_contains.description: Return projects with description containing the specified string

description_not_contains.description: Return projects with description not containing the specified string

external_id_equals.description: Find projects by a specific external ID

external_id_not_equals.description: Find projects excluding the one with the specified external ID

actual_start_date_from.description: Return projects started on or after the specified date

actual_start_date_to.description: Return projects started on or before the specified date

actual_end_date_from.description: Return projects ended on or after the specified date

actual_end_date_to.description: Return projects ended on or before the specified date

target_start_date_from.description: Return projects targeted to start on or after the specified date

target_start_date_to.description: Return projects targeted to start on or before the specified date

target_end_date_from.description: Return projects targeted to end on or after the specified date

target_end_date_to.description: Return projects targeted to end on or before the specified date

actual_spend_amount_from.description: Return projects with actual spend amount equal or greater than the specified amount

actual_spend_amount_to.description: Return projects with actual spend amount equal or smaller than the specified amount

approved_spend_amount_from.description: Return projects with approved spend amount equal or greater than the specified amount

approved_spend_amount_to.description: Return projects with approved spend amount equal or smaller than the specified amount

estimated_savings_amount_from.description: Return projects with estimated savings amount equal or greater than the specified amount

estimated_savings_amount_to.description: Return projects with estimated savings amount equal or smaller than the specified amount

estimated_spend_amount_from.description: Return projects with estimated spend amount equal or greater than the specified amount

estimated_spend_amount_to.description: Return projects with estimated spend amount equal or smaller than the specified amount

canceled_note_contains.description: Return projects with cancelation note containing the specified string

canceled_note_not_contains.description: Return projects with cancelation note not containing the specified string

canceled_note_empty.description: Return projects with an empty cancelation note

canceled_note_not_empty.description: Return projects with a non-empty cancelation note

canceled_reason_contains.description: Return projects with cancelation reason containing the specified string

canceled_reason_not_contains.description: Return projects with cancelation reason not containing the specified string

canceled_reason_empty.description: Return projects with an empty cancelation reason

canceled_reason_not_empty.description: Return projects with a non-empty cancelation reason

on_hold_note_contains.description: Return projects with on-hold note containing the specified string

on_hold_note_not_contains.description: Return projects with on-hold note not containing the specified string

on_hold_note_empty.description: Return projects with an empty on-hold note

on_hold_note_not_empty.description: Return projects with a non-empty on-hold note

on_hold_reason_contains.description: Return projects with on-hold reason containing the specified string

on_hold_reason_not_contains.description: Return projects with on-hold reason not containing the specified string

on_hold_reason_empty.description: Return projects with an empty on-hold reason

on_hold_reason_not_empty.description: Return projects with a non-empty on-hold reason

needs_attention_equals.description: Return projects with the specified "needs attention" status

needs_attention_not_equals.description: Return projects with the "needs attention" status not equal to the specified one

state_equals.description: Find projects with specified statuses (draft, requested, planned, active, completed, canceled, on_hold)

marked_as_needs_attention_at_from.description: Find projects marked as "needs attention" after or on the specified date

marked_as_needs_attention_at_to.description: Find projects marked as "needs attention" before or on the specified date

needs_attention_note_contains.description: Return projects with "needs attention" note containing the specified string

needs_attention_note_not_contains.description: Return projects with "needs attention" note not containing the specified string

needs_attention_note_empty.description: Return projects with an empty "needs attention" note

needs_attention_note_not_empty.description: Return projects with a non-empty "needs attention" note

needs_attention_reason_contains.description: Return projects with "needs attention" reason containing the specified string

needs_attention_reason_not_contains.description: Return projects with "needs attention" reason not containing the specified string

needs_attention_reason_empty.description: Return projects with an empty "needs attention" reason

needs_attention_reason_not_empty.description: Return projects with a non-empty "needs attention" reason

project_pagination_settings.description:
A dictionary containing pagination settings with 'size' parameter
to limit the number of results per page (default: 10, max: 100).
If None, no pagination is applied.

name: find_scim_users
description:
Retrieves a list of users based on specified filtering, sorting, and pagination criteria.

This endpoint adheres to SCIM (System for Cross-domain Identity Management) standards.
Supports complex filtering via SCIM filter syntax and offers a 100-item default page size.

scim_user_attributes_to_return.description:
Comma-separated list of specific attributes to return.
- Enum: "userName", "name.familyName", "name.givenName", "roles", "roles.value",
"externalId", "active", "meta.lastModified", "meta.created", "id"

scim_user_filter_query.description:
SCIM-compliant filter expression to search for users.
Example:
    'userName eq "jhon.doe@example.com" and meta.lastModified gt "2011-05-13T04:42:34Z"'
Supported attributes:
    - "userName"
    - "name.familyName"
    - "name.givenName"
    - "roles"
    - "roles.value"
    - "externalId"
    - "active"
    - "meta.lastModified"
    - "meta.created"
Supported operators:
    - eq: Equal to
    - ne: Not equal to
    - lt: Less than
    - le: Less than or equal to
    - gt: Greater than
    - ge: Greater than or equal to
    - pr: Present
    - co: Contains
    - and: Logical "and"
    - or: Logical "or"
    - not: Logical "not"

scim_pagination_start_index.description: 1-based index of the first query result. Must be >= 1.

scim_pagination_result_count.description: Number of results to return per page. Must be >= 0.

scim_sort_attribute.description:
Attribute used to order results.
- Allowed values: "id", "externalId"

name: get_all_contract_milestone_entries
description:
Retrieves a list of contract milestone report entries.

Returns paginated milestone entries submitted under contract reports. Used for tracking progress or performance milestones across contracts.

name: get_all_event_report_entries
description:
Retrieves a list of event report entries.

Event report entries contain detailed records of events captured within the system. These can include audit events, workflow triggers, system updates, etc. The response is paginated and supports traversal through `next` and `prev` links.

name: get_all_event_templates
description: Returns a list of all event templates.

name: get_all_payment_currencies
description: Retrieves a list of all available payment currencies in the system.

name: get_all_payment_terms
description: Retrieves a list of all available payment terms in the system.

name: get_all_payment_types
description: Retrieves a list of all available payment types in the system.

name: get_all_performance_review_answer_entries
description:
Retrieves a list of performance review answer entries.

This endpoint returns detailed entries from performance review responses, useful for evaluation analysis, tracking progress, and generating summaries. Pagination is supported via `next` and `prev` links.

name: get_all_performance_review_entries
description:
Retrieves a list of performance review report entries.

Returns detailed performance review report data in a paginated format. Each entry contains attributes related to a performance review. Use pagination links to iterate through results.

name: get_all_project_milestone_entries
description:
Retrieves a list of project milestone report entries.

Each milestone entry provides details related to project milestones.

name: get_all_project_types
description:
Retrieves a list of all available project types in the system.

Each project type includes a name and a short code. This information is useful for categorizing and identifying different types of projects in workflows and project planning.

name: get_all_savings_report_entries
description:
Retrieves a list of savings report entries.

Returns all savings-related entries available to the authenticated user.

name: get_all_scim_resource_types
description:
Lists SCIM resource types available on the service provider.

This endpoint allows clients to discover all supported SCIM resource types and their associated metadata, including endpoint paths and schemas. This is based on Section 4 of RFC 7644.

name: get_all_supplier_companies
description:
Retrieves a list of supplier companies matching the specified filters and options.

Supports filtering, pagination, and compound document formatting via the `include` parameter to reduce multiple requests.

supplier_query_filters.description: Filter supplier companies by criteria. One filter per attribute.

include_associated_resources.description:
Comma-separated list of related resources to include.
- Enum: "attachments", "supplier_category", "supplier_groups", "default_payment_term",
"payment_types", "default_payment_type", "payment_currencies",
"default_payment_currency", "supplier_classification_values"

name: get_all_supplier_report_entries
description: This function retrieves all supplier report entries.

name: get_all_supplier_review_entries
description:
Returns a list of supplier review report entries.

This function retrieves all entries from the supplier review report. It supports pagination
and includes metadata to navigate through result pages.

name: get_attachments_by_id_list
description:
Retrieve a filtered list of attachments based on specified IDs.

This function returns a list of attachments matching the provided IDs, with a maximum
limit of 50 attachments per request.

attachment_id_filter_list.description: Comma-separated string of attachment IDs to filter by.

name: get_bid_line_item_schema_fields
description:
Retrieves the list of available fields for bid line item objects.

This function returns a comprehensive list of all fields that can be present
in a bid line item object, based on the schema definition in the system.

name: get_bid_schema_fields
description: Returns a list of fields for the bid object.

name: get_contacts_for_company_by_external_id
description:
Retrieves a list of contacts for a specific supplier company.

This function returns supplier contacts associated with a given supplier company ID.
Supports detailed filtering, relationship includes, and pagination options.

supplier_company_id_for_lookup.description:
Required. Unique identifier of the supplier company.
Example: 1

related_contact_info_to_include.description:
Comma-separated list of related resources to include in the response.
Allowed values:
- "supplier_company"
- "contact_types"
- "phones"

updated_at_from.description: Return contacts updated on or after this timestamp.

updated_at_to.description: Return contacts updated on or before this timestamp.

contact_filtering_options.description:
Dictionary of filter parameters to narrow down contact results.
Supported filters include:

name: get_custom_fields_with_filter
description: Returns a list of custom fields for the specified criteria.

field_filter_criteria.description:
A dictionary containing field attributes and their desired values for filtering.
If None, returns all fields. Supported filters:

group_id_equals.description: ID of the group for which fields should be selected

target_object_equals.description: Find custom fields by target class name

name: get_entries_for_event_report
description:
Retrieves a list of event report entries for a specific event report.

This endpoint provides detailed entries linked to a single event report, identified by `event_report_id`. It is useful for retrieving scoped data related to a specific event. The response is paginated.

target_event_report_id.description: Unique identifier for the event report to retrieve entries from.

name: get_entries_for_project_report
description:
Retrieves a list of report entries for a specified project report.

Accepts an optional project_report_id parameter in newer API versions (2019-01-01 and later). Use this to scope results to a particular report.

target_project_report_id.description: Unique identifier of the project report.

name: get_line_items_for_award
description: Retrieve line items associated with a specific award.

target_award_identifier.description: The unique identifier of the award to retrieve line items for.

quoted_status_filter.description:
Filter line items by their quoted status.
True for quoted items, False for non-quoted items.

line_item_type_filter.description:
Return awards line items with specified line item types.
Valid types include: "STANDARD", "GOODS", "SERVICES".

include_award_line_item_relations.description:
Use the _include parameter to request related resources along with the primary resource.
Supported includes: "supplier_company", "worksheet".

name: get_line_items_for_contract_award
description:
Retrieves a list of line items associated with a specific contract award.

This function returns all line items that are linked to the specified award ID,
allowing for detailed analysis of award components and their associated data.
The line items provide granular information about the award's components.

parent_award_id.description:
The unique identifier of the award for which to retrieve
line items.

name: get_line_items_for_event_worksheet
description: Returns a list of line items for the specified criteria.

associated_event_id.description: The unique identifier of the event to which the line items belong.

associated_worksheet_id.description: The unique identifier of the worksheet to which the line items belong.

name: get_my_event_report_entries
description:
Retrieves a list of event report entries owned by the user.

**Deprecated**: This endpoint is only supported in API version 2018-04-01 and has been deprecated as of 2019-01-01. It returns report entries specific to the authenticated user.

name: get_my_project_report_entries
description:
Retrieves a list of project report entries owned by the user.

Deprecated: This endpoint is only available for API version `2018-04-01`. It has been removed in versions released after `2019-01-01`.

name: link_suppliers_to_project_by_external_ref
description: Adds one or more supplier companies to a project using external identifiers.

target_project_external_id.description: The external identifier of the project.

list_of_supplier_external_ids.description: A list of supplier company external IDs to add to the project.

name: list_supplier_company_field_names
description:
Describes the Supplier Company object fields.

Returns a list of field names for the Supplier Company resource. This metadata 
is useful for understanding the available fields that can be used when working 
with supplier company data.

name: modify_attachment_by_external_id
description: Update an existing attachment by its external ID.

attachment_external_id_to_update.description: The external ID of the attachment to update.

attachment_modification_data.description: Dictionary containing the fields to update with their new values.

name: modify_attachment_by_internal_id
description: Update an existing attachment by its internal ID.

attachment_id_to_update.description: The internal ID of the attachment to update.

attachment_update_data.description: Dictionary containing the fields to update with their new values.

name: modify_company_contact_by_ids
description:
Updates the details of an existing supplier company contact.

This function allows modification of contact information by providing updated
values for specific fields. The contact is identified by both company ID and
contact ID.

target_company_id.description:
The unique identifier of the supplier company.
This is the internal ID used by the system to reference the company.

target_contact_id.description:
The unique identifier of the contact.
This is the internal ID used by the system to reference the contact.

response_data_to_include.description:
Comma-separated list of related resources to include
in the response. Not fully implemented in simulation.

role.description: The contact's role in the company

contact_update_payload.description:
Dictionary containing the fields to update.
Required fields:
- At least one field to update
Optional fields:

name: modify_contact_category_by_external_id
description:
Updates the details of an existing contact type using its external ID.

This function allows for the modification of an existing contact type's properties
by searching for it using its external identifier. It performs validation checks
to ensure the update is valid and the contact type exists before applying the
changes. The function supports partial updates of contact type properties.

contact_type_external_id.description: The unique external identifier of the contact type to update.

contact_category_update_payload.description:
A dictionary containing the updated properties for
the contact type. The dictionary must include:

name: modify_contract_by_external_id

include_updated_contract_data.description:
Comma-separated list of relationships to include
in the response.
Supported values: "contract_type", "spend_category", "supplier_company", "docusign_envelopes", "adobe_sign_agreements"

contract_modification_payload.description: Dictionary containing the fields to update. Must include:

marked_as_needs_attention_at.description: Date and time when contract was flagged as needs attention

needs_attention_note.description: Notes on why contract needs attention

renew_number_of_times.description: Number of times contract should be renewed

renewal_term_value.description: Number of term units between renewals

renewal_termination_notice_value.description: Term units before end date for notice

renewal_termination_reminder_value.description: Term units before notice for reminder

approved_at.description: Date and time of contract approval

approval_rounds.description: Times contract has been sent for approval

name: modify_contract_by_internal_id
description: Update an existing contract by its internal ID.

contract_id_to_update.description: The internal identifier of the contract to update.

include_updated_contract_relationships.description:
Comma-separated list of relationships to include
in the response.
Supported values: "contract_type", "spend_category", "supplier_company", "docusign_envelopes", "adobe_sign_agreements"

contract_update_data.description: Dictionary containing the fields to update. Includes any of the following keys:

marked_as_needs_attention_at.description: Date and time when contract was flagged as needs attention

needs_attention_note.description: Notes on why contract needs attention

renew_number_of_times.description: Number of times contract should be renewed

renewal_term_value.description: Number of term units between renewals

renewal_termination_notice_value.description: Term units before end date for notice

renewal_termination_reminder_value.description: Term units before notice for reminder

approved_at.description: Date and time of contract approval

approval_rounds.description: Times contract has been sent for approval

name: modify_contract_type_by_external_id
description: Update an existing contract type by its external ID.

contract_type_external_ref_for_update.description: The external identifier of the contract type to update.

contract_type_modification_data.description: Dictionary containing the fields to update. Must include:

external_id.description: Must match the external_id parameter in the URL

name: modify_contract_type_by_internal_id
description: Update an existing contract type by its internal ID.

contract_type_id_for_modification.description: The internal identifier of the contract type to update.

contract_type_update_data.description: Dictionary containing the fields to update. Must include:

id.description: Must match the id parameter in the URL

name: modify_currency_by_external_ref
description: Updates the details of an existing payment currency using its external identifier.

currency_external_identifier.description: The external identifier of the currency to update.

new_alpha_currency_code.description: The new three-letter currency code (e.g., USD, EUR).

name: modify_currency_by_internal_id
description: Updates the details of an existing payment currency using its internal identifier.

currency_internal_id.description: The internal identifier of the currency to update.

updated_alpha_currency_code.description: The new three-letter currency code (e.g., USD, EUR).

updated_currency_external_id.description: The new external identifier for the currency.

name: modify_event_details_by_id
description: Update an existing event.

event_id_for_modification.description: The unique identifier of the event to update.

event_update_payload.description: Dictionary containing the fields to update. Must include:

id.description: Must match the id parameter in the URL

spend_amount.description: Actual spend amount used to calculate savings and keep reporting up to date

late_bids.description: Whether late bid submissions are allowed

revise_bids.description: Whether suppliers are allowed to re-submit bids

instant_notifications.description: When true, notification emails are sent immediately; when false, notifications are delivered every 3 hours in a digest form

external_id.description: Event ID in your internal database

restricted.description: Whether event is invitation only even when posted on the public site

custom_fields.description: Custom field values (note: custom fields of type File can only be accessed through the user interface, they will be exposed as null in the public API)

name: modify_field_by_external_id
description:
Updates the details of an existing field by its external ID.

This function updates the properties of a field identified by its external
identifier. The function verifies that the provided body includes the correct
external ID before performing the update.

field_external_id_for_update.description: The external identifier of the field to update.

field_update_payload.description:
A dictionary containing the updated properties
for the field, including:

external_id.description: Must match the external_id in the URL

type.description: Updated data type of the field

name: modify_field_group_by_identifier
description: Updates the details of an existing field group.

field_group_id_to_update.description: The unique identifier of the field group to update.

field_group_update_data.description:
A dictionary containing the updated properties for the
field group, including any of the following fields:

id.description: Field group identifier string. Same as the id parameter.

fields.description: List of fields belonging to this group

target_object.description:
Field group object type string, one of:
        - "PROJECT"
        - "SUPPLIER_COMPANY"
        - "RFP"

name: modify_field_options_by_id
description: Update a field options with given parameters.

field_option_identifier.description: The unique identifier of the field option to update.

replacement_field_options_list.description: A list of new options to set for the field option.

name: modify_field_properties_by_id
description:
Updates the details of an existing field using its internal identifier.

Please note, that request body must include an id attribute with the value of your field unique identifier,the same one you passed as argument.

field_id_for_update.description: The internal identifier of the field to update.

updated_field_properties.description:
A dictionary containing the field properties to update.
Must include an 'id' field matching the path parameter.
Contains any of the following fields:

type_description.description:
Internal name and meaning of each field, one of:
            - "Checkbox"
            - "File"
            - "Short Text"
            - "Paragraph"
            - "Date"
            - "Integer"
            - "Currency"
            - "Decimal"
            - "Single Select"
            - "Multiple Select"
            - "URL"
            - "Lookup"
            - "Related"

required.description: Identifies whether the field is required

group.description:
Reference to the field group where the field belongs to
            Note: Must be null for fields with target_object set to RFP, and required for all other fields

name: modify_payment_method_by_external_ref
description: Updates the details of an existing payment type using its external identifier.

payment_type_external_ref.description: The external identifier of the payment type to update.

new_payment_type_name.description: The new name for the payment type.

new_payment_method_value.description: The new payment method. One of: "Direct Deposit", "Check", "EFT", "Cash", "Credit Card", "Wire", "Manual", "Direct Debit", "PayPal", "EFT with Reference"

name: modify_payment_term_by_external_ref
description: Updates the details of an existing payment term using its external identifier.

payment_term_external_id_to_update.description: The external identifier of the payment term to update.

updated_payment_term_name.description: The new name for the payment term (e.g., "Net 30", "Net 60").

name: modify_payment_term_by_id
description: Updates the details of an existing payment term using its internal identifier.

payment_term_id_to_update.description: The internal identifier of the payment term to update.

new_payment_term_name.description: The name for the payment term.

new_payment_term_external_id.description: The external identifier for the payment term.

name: modify_payment_type_by_id
description: Updates the details of an existing payment type using its internal identifier.

payment_type_internal_id.description: The internal identifier of the payment type to update.

updated_payment_type_name.description: The new name for the payment type.

updated_payment_method_value.description: The new payment method. One of: "Direct Deposit", "Check", "EFT", "Cash", "Credit Card", "Wire", "Manual", "Direct Debit", "PayPal", "EFT with Reference"

updated_payment_type_external_id.description: The new external identifier for the payment type.

name: modify_project_by_external_id
description: Updates the details of an existing project using its external identifier.

project_external_id_to_update.description: The unique external identifier of the project to update.

project_update_payload.description:
A dictionary containing the updated project details.
Must include an 'external_id' field matching the provided ID.

external_id.description: Project external identifier string. Same as the provided ID.

state.description: Project state (draft, requested, planned, active, completed, canceled, on_hold)

marked_as_needs_attention_at.description: Project marked as needs attention timestamp

name: modify_project_by_internal_id
description: Updates the details of an existing project using its unique internal identifier.

project_id_for_update.description: The unique internal identifier of the project to update.

updated_project_information.description:
A dictionary containing the updated project details.
Validated against ProjectDataInputModel.
Must include an 'id' field whose string representation matches the provided path ID.

name: modify_spend_category_by_external_id
description:
Updates an existing spend category with new attributes.

The spend category must be identified by its unique ID (same as provided in the path). Only fields passed in the payload will be updated; others remain unchanged.

spend_category_external_id_to_update.description: Unique identifier of the spend category to update.

updated_spend_category_usages.description:
Optional. Applicable contexts.
- Enum: "procurement", "expense", "ad_hoc_payment", "supplier_invoice"
- name (str): Optional. Spend category name (max 255 characters).
- external_id (str): Optional. External system ID (max 255 characters).
- usages (List[str]): Optional. Applicable contexts.
    - Enum: "procurement", "expense", "ad_hoc_payment", "supplier_invoice"

name: modify_spend_category_by_internal_id
description:
Updates the details of an existing spend category using its internal identifier.

The internal ID must match the one provided in the URL path. All parameters are optional and only the provided fields will be updated.

spend_category_id_to_update.description: Internal identifier for the spend category to be updated.

new_spend_category_external_id.description: New or same external identifier (max 255 characters).

name: modify_supplier_company_by_external_ref
description:
Updates an existing supplier company using its external identifier.

This endpoint allows updating a supplier company's attributes and relationships using its external ID. The request body must include an `id` that matches the identifier in the path.

company_external_id_for_update.description: Required. External identifier of the supplier company (e.g., "1234-5678-abcd-efgh").

include_resources_in_update_response.description:
Comma-separated list of related resources to include in the response.
Enum values:
- "attachments"
- "supplier_category"
- "supplier_groups"
- "default_payment_term"
- "payment_types"
- "default_payment_type"
- "payment_currencies"
- "default_payment_currency"
- "supplier_classification_values"

relationships.description:
Updated linked resources.
    - supplier_category, external_supplier_category (dict): Supplier category by ID or external ID.
    - supplier_groups, external_supplier_groups (List[dict]): Group associations by ID or external ID.
    - default_payment_term, external_default_payment_term (dict): Default payment term by ID or external ID.
    - payment_types, external_payment_types (List[dict]): Accepted payment types.
    - default_payment_type, external_default_payment_type (dict): Default payment method.
    - payment_currencies, external_payment_currencies (List[dict]): Accepted currencies.
    - default_payment_currency, external_default_payment_currency (dict): Default currency.

supplier_company_update_payload.description: The payload used to update the supplier company.

name: modify_supplier_company_by_id
description:
Updates the details of an existing supplier company.

This endpoint allows modification of a supplier company's attributes and relationships. You must provide the unique identifier of the supplier company (same as in the path) in the request body. When updating relationships, the entire existing relationship is replaced by the provided values.

supplier_company_id_to_update.description:
Required. Unique identifier of the supplier company.
Example: 1

include_related_data_in_supplier_update.description:
Comma-separated list of related resources to include in the response.
Allowed values:
- "attachments"
- "supplier_category"
- "supplier_groups"
- "default_payment_term"
- "payment_types"
- "default_payment_type"
- "payment_currencies"
- "default_payment_currency"
- "supplier_classification_values"

id.description: Supplier company ID (must match the path parameter).

name.description: Required. Name of the supplier (≤ 255 characters).

public.description: Whether the company is publicly listed.

risk.description: Risk slug defined by your organization.

external_id.description: Your internal system ID for the supplier.

custom_fields.description:
List of custom field entries. Each entry can be of multiple supported types.
        Note: File-type custom fields are only accessible via UI and return `null` in the API.

        Supported types include:
            - Checkbox
            - Short Text
            - Paragraph
            - Date
            - Integer
            - Currency
            - Decimal
            - Single Select
            - Multiple Select
            - URL
            - Lookup
            - Related

relationships.description:
Supplier relationships (replaces existing data).
    - supplier_category
    - supplier_groups
    - default_payment_term
    - payment_types

name: modify_supplier_contact_by_external_ref
description:
Updates the details of an existing supplier contact using the external ID.

The function modifies a supplier contact’s attributes and relationships such as contact types
and phone numbers, identified via the external ID. The request body must include the contact's
internal `id`, which must match the contact's actual identifier in the system.

Comma-separated list of related resources to include in the response.

name: modify_supplier_contact_details

Updates the details of an existing supplier contact.

Comma-separated list of related resources to include in the response.

- "supplier_company"
- "contact_types"
- "phones"

id.description: Required. Must match the `id` in the URL path.

name.description: Required unless both `first_name` and `last_name` are provided. Full name (≤ 255 chars).

is_suggested.description: If the contact is unapproved or suggested.

updated_contact_payload.description: Payload containing the updated supplier contact information.

name: modify_worksheet_line_item_details

name: overwrite_scim_user_details
description:
Replaces all updatable attributes of a User resource as per RFC 7644 Section 3.5.1.

This operation replaces only the attributes provided in the request payload, leaving any others intact.
Users cannot deactivate themselves or modify their email domain unless it's compliant with configured SSO rules.

scim_user_id_to_replace.description: Unique SCIM identifier of the user to update.

userName.description: Required. User's email address. Must match configured SSO domain for updates.

active.description: Optional. Whether the user account is active.

full_user_replacement_data.description: A dictionary containing the user attributes to update.

name: patch_scim_user_attributes
description:
Applies partial updates to a User resource using a sequence of SCIM-compliant patch operations.

This endpoint supports `add`, `remove`, and `replace` operations as described in RFC 7644 Section 3.5.2.
Common use cases include changing the user's name, deactivating accounts, or updating metadata.

Note:
    - Users cannot deactivate their own account (403).
    - Changes to `userName` require both the original and target domains to match those configured in the company SSO setup.
    - All PATCH operations must conform to SCIM and system-specific constraints.

scim_user_id_to_patch.description: Unique SCIM identifier of the user to patch.

schemas.description: SCIM schema identifiers. Must include SCIM PATCH schema URI.

path.description: SCIM path to the attribute being modified. Required for "remove".

value.description: Value to assign or append. Can be a primitive or nested structure.

Operations.description: A list of operations to apply.

scim_patch_operations_payload.description:
A dictionary containing the patch operations, conforming to SCIM schema.
It must contain the following keys:

name: provision_new_scim_user
description:
Creates a new user with the specified attributes.

This operation is SCIM-compliant and requires a payload defining the user details.
Supports external identifiers for integration with client systems.

userName.description: Required. Email address of the user.

active.description: Optional. Whether the user account is active.

roles.description: Optional. Roles assigned to the user.

new_scim_user_data.description: The user resource to create. The structure is defined by the SCIM User schema.

Creates a new spend category with specified attributes.

Spend categories are used to classify spend for procurement, expense, ad-hoc payment, or supplier invoice use cases. Only categories with the "procurement" usage can be used in requisitions.

Creates a new supplier company with specified attributes, linked resources, and optional custom fields.

    - default_payment_currency

    - supplier_classification_values

name: retrieve_bids_for_event
description:
Returns a list of all bids. Only bids for events of type RFP are returned

This function returns all bids linked to the specified event, with support
for filtering, pagination, and optional inclusion of related data. Only
bids for events of type RFP (Request for Proposal) are returned. The function
supports comprehensive filtering and data inclusion options.

event_id_for_bid_retrieval.description:
The unique identifier of the event for which to retrieve
bids.

bid_search_filters.description: A dictionary containing filter criteria for bids. Each key represents a filter field with its corresponding value. Supported filters:

intend_to_bid_equals.description: Return bids with specified "intent to bid" status

intend_to_bid_not_equals.description: Return bids with "intent to bid" status not equal to specified value

intend_to_bid_answered_at_from.description: Return bids with intend_to_bid updated on or after timestamp

intend_to_bid_answered_at_to.description: Return bids with intend_to_bid updated on or before timestamp

submitted_at_from.description: Return bids with submitted_at on or after timestamp

submitted_at_to.description: Return bids with submitted_at on or before timestamp

resubmitted_at_from.description: Return bids with resubmitted_at on or after timestamp

resubmitted_at_to.description: Return bids with resubmitted_at on or before timestamp

status_equals.description: Find bids with specified statuses (award_retracted, awarded, draft, rejected, rejection_retracted, resubmitted, revising, submitted, unclaimed, update_requested)

supplier_company_id_equals.description: Find bids by specific Supplier Company IDs

supplier_company_external_id_equals.description: Find bids by specific Supplier Company External IDs

include_related_bid_data.description:
A string specifying additional related resources to include in the response. Supported values:
- "event": Include event details
- "supplier_company": Include supplier company details
Defaults to None.

size.description: The number of results returned per page. Default is 10, maximum is 100.
